11.text: which I will then place in the missing areas,

these fills would act both as support and

18.text: To make a mould for my plaster fills

21.text:
I decided to use the two parts moulding and
casting technique.

29.text:
to create a plasticine base for my plaster
fill

and I also put some plasticine underneath

to raise it slightly over the surface of the

Following this, I have this solder which I've

and this is going to create keying for my

46.text: This is an old example of a two-part mould

50.text:
and as you can see they help the two part

55.text:
Also, you can see here two kind of bamboo
sticks,

60.text:
in order to create channels so that later
on

65.text:
I can put my epoxy resin through these channels

72.text:
As you can see here I started building my
wall along the kind of edges of my plasticine

84.text:
you need fresh and soft plasticine to work
on this

88.text:
because otherwise, it gets really hard to

93.text:
So now I will start making the one part of
the two-part mould

97.text:
in order to take the mould from the under
side of my plaster fill.

102.text:
I'm going to start measuring the moulding

107.text:
which will be about four hundred grams of

113.text:
and catalyst actually helps fasten the setting
process of the mould.

125.text:
Now it's time to add around five drops of
catalyst into it.

136.text:
Once I put the silicone rubber mixture into
the plasticine walls,

140.text:
I'll leave it for about 24 hours, so until
tomorrow afternoon

145.text: before I can actually remove the whole thing

148.text:
and turn it around to start making the second

164.text:
I have to prepare the epoxy resin about an
hour before I start casting

169.text:
the reason for this is because when I mix
the two parts of the epoxy resin I have to

178.text:
and this causes a lot of air bubbles within
the resin itself.

181.text:
Even though the urn has a lot of bubbles within
the glass

186.text:
I still do not want an excessive amounts of
air bubbles within my resin fill,

192.text: for this reason, I left it for an hour

195.text: and now it's time to pour it into my mould.

199.text:
I prepared two plastic funnels by cutting
plastic disposable pipettes

207.text:
and I will place one of them here which I
will pour the resin in

212.text: and the other one will go in here

215.text:
so that I can also monitor when there's enough
resin in the mould

221.text: so that the resin might start coming up,

224.text:
that means that I have enough resin in my
mould and I should stop pouring more.

229.text: So I put some resin into the funnel

231.text:
and as you can see slowly slowly the resin
is going down.

236.text:
As you can see the mould is now full, it doesn't
